Reviews.Title: “The only choice”
Reviews.Author: RonnySigura
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotels have become so expensive compared to other cities in Asia. This hotel is among the most economical in all terms: 1. Rates are quite inxpensive compare to other Singapore hotels (how ever with the same money you can get a lot more better hotels in other Asian cities) 2. If you are just into shopping regular items, this is the place (Mustafa Center gate4 is at your doorstep for 24hours) 3. Variaty foods especially Indian foods at a reasonable price are abundant 4.It takes about 10min walking leisurely to the nearest MRT station

Reviews.Title: “Small, small room”
Reviews.Author: Danno_99
Reviews.Content: Arianna is nicely situated right opposite Mustafa (5 minutes away from an MRT station) – so anything you may be missing is right across the street, I arrived quite early but was only able to check in at one o’clock (quite possibly because they were full and had to wait for someone to vacate a room). Every time I believe I have seen the smallest room possible, I stumble across one where the pygmy builders have outdone themselves and managed to create an even smaller room. The room at arianna was tiny, and had no windows. The bed was decently sized (somewhere between a single and a double), wedged into a corner of the room. There was about 30cm of clearance in front – just enough to shove a suitcase in – and about 60 cm of space on one side. There’s a mirror and a small shelf (20cm wide or so), a small fridge (!) and a couple of shelves with hanging space and a room safe. No bedside lamp. The ensuite bathroom was (surprisingly…) tiny. A sink, a toilet and a shower are all crammed together with no room for even a shower curtain – so when you shower everything in the bathroom gets wet. There is also no decent ventilation for the bathroom so it remains wet and damp. On the plus side, the room was quite clean, and they also provide a kettle and some cups (with sachets of tea, coffee etc) and a hair drier. There was also a small LCD TV, which had a couple of English language channels. Wifi worked fine and was fairly fast (2mbps or so). Overall, could not get over the size of the room. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad decision!”
Reviews.Author: Luah G
Reviews.Content: Was our first time in Singapore and we booked the hotel by price and location. We confess that just the services are nice, forget the other stuffs. The bed is very hard and old, we felt the iron in our backs and when we arrived the room was very very dirty, we had to call to the reception to ask for clean it. If you go for a walk around, you can find better options to stay. One importat thing, they are rebuilding the street in front of the hotel ... lots of noise in the morning. (26/03/2012)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but no cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: cj_shiju
Reviews.Content: After reading "Zee7" comments (below), I was worried whether my booking wud hav been rejected as my Creditcard also have double security feature. As I was check-in late nite, I was more worried. But luckily my booking was still available and the guy in reception was quite friendly. About the room: We got the room adjacent to the main road (can watch Mustafa Center from our window). Rooms were small, had some basic toiletries, water-heater, Hair Dryer, small refrigerator, locker, 22-inch LED TV but only local channels, Wifi was there but Internet was always down. Good things: Great Location, bang opposite Mustafa Center - 24 hours shopping palace where we can get anything you want. Good for many great & authentic Indian foods. Farrer park MRT is just 10 mins walk away. Bad things: Room floors were not clean. It was dusty. No Carpets. I told the Room Service Lady to clean the floor before I left outside. But when I came back the rooms was still dirty. There was construction work going outside, on the road (Added to the crowd noise in Mustafa Center). So it was very noisy the whole day. Also there was construction work going on inside the hotel also. Day-time whole day the rooms were noisy. Would I stay again? Maybe. I like it for its location & food.

Reviews.Title: “No frills budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinta_alamaya
Reviews.Content: my family and i stayed at Arianna Hotel for 3 nights and we booked 3 rooms. the room was not bad,have phone,lcd tv,safety box,hair dryer and kettle to boil water. Pro's:clean room,wifi,nice lobby(for budget hotel),good location and smooth check out...phew! con's:Check in not very smooth,small room,small bed and stained towels! overall,i wont mind staying at this hotel in the future ;)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Budget”
Reviews.Author: PCUY
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights with family. Small room, wash and other basic facilities, but could manage with twin-beds in the room. The hotel is usually very clean. Free internet but no other frills but you have common treated potable water filter station to fill your kits. Meets your needs and ofcourse affordable when you have an extended holiday stay in Singapore and particularly when you leave early in the morning and return late in night. Very conveniently located opposite to Mustafa Shopping Centre (24 hours open). 5-minute walk to Farrer Park MRT station from where you can go straight to Sentosa and Universla Studios. The location also offers wide choice of PURE VEGETARIAN INDIAN RESTAURANTS. Overall very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Budget traveler's choice”
Reviews.Author: ariellek_bj
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotels can be expensive. We stopped through Singapore for one night and had to leave for the airport on an early morning flight. So we chose this hotel for its convenient location and its affordable price. That said, getting to this hotel involves a 20-minute walk to the Lavender or Bugis MRT station. Rooms are small and narrow, or shall we say space-efficient. Amenities are basic and no-frills. The bathroom was a shower combined with a toilet. The advantage of staying in a budget hotel in Singapore is that we can be sure the rooms adhere to high hygiene standards. Also, because Singapore's tap water is safe to drink, the absence of free bottles of distilled/mineral water in the no-frills room was fine with us. Nearby Indian restaurants offer a wide range of both (very authentic) Indian and Chinese/Singaporean cuisine, with choices of any price range. Of course expectations have to be adjusted as this is a budget hotel. A bit more context: This is my 6th or 7th trip to Singapore and I have previously stayed in everything from the Shangri-La and St Regis to other budget options such as the YMCA. We were also two travellers sharing one room, and we got a good price even though we booked only 2 weeks in advance. If you need a decent room and you're ready to explore Little India's culture and cuisine, Arianna would be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Genevie A
Reviews.Content: Don't expect the luxuries of a hotel if you are going to stay here. We chose this hotel because aside from it is cheap, we will be out of the hotel most of the time touring the city. The room has complete amenities, ample water supply, it's near the shopping center, and 5 min walk from the MRT. The room is tidy but not cleaned well. There was thick dust sprawling under the bed. It's not something you see once you walk in, unless you inspect. You have to know that since it is located in Little India, there are a lot of Muslims in the area. But it's really safe. You can walk around at midnight. One thing we didn't like is the ongoing construction which made it hard for us to sleep at night. And the location is not exactly downtown where the nice spots are. Wouldn't be booking here next time. Definitely we'll get a hotel where the more famous hotels and shops are. It's recommended for a traveler who just needs a bed to stay and is always out all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Really in the Centre of Shopping Centre”
Reviews.Author: masrura
Reviews.Content: My reason to stay in this hotel was the Location. The hotel location in front of the Mustafa Shopping complex, 24 hours open. Surrounding by many restaurant specially Indian rest and safe for Moslem who look for the Halal Food. The room was small and the matras was very hard Compare to other budget hotel. I have very good price when booked it through their website compare to other website and you pay it when you arrive and check out only gift your no of credit card. There is no breakfast provided but you can easy find in the restaurant near it. A bus to Orchad only 5 minute walking and the MRT stasion farrer park only 10 minutes walk and sentosa Island only a few stasion in the same line. But if you use mrt to or from airport you have to change it 2x.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Hotel with small room but good location”
Reviews.Author: saphire4
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is extremely small. They charge 110 $ Singapore for their small room. Te reason people come to this hotel because it is located near Mustafa Center a very popular shopping center. The hotel has good wi fi. When I asked for a glass to drink water they refused. The front desk clerk bluntly said they do not provide glasses to Hotel customers. Thats the dumbest thing I ever heard. The hotel is clean. I got tired of the small room with no window. The only reason I stayed in this Hotel because of the location. Just walking distance from Mustafa center. It is also close to Ferrer Park Mrt Station. You will find lot of restaurants and fast foods near the hotel. I think they get customers because of the location......

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: triippyy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was cosy and it was perfect for a solo stay. Moreover, it had all the necessary amenities and the prices are amazing. There is a 24 hour shopping centre just a stones throw away which adds more value to its location. With a train station in its vicinity, i do not have to walk far or take a cab like other tourists in singapore. Overall this place is great for its location and prices. After all, you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Expect Pure Misery”
Reviews.Author: Zee7
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 2PM for my stay on Thursday, October 13th. Presented my name. The front desk agent looked me up and said, "sir we weren't able to authorize your credit card and cancelled your reservation". I shrugged and said, "here you go" and presented my credit card. The front desk agent laughed and said "hold on" and called someone secretly to discuss my reservation. He says, "sorry, we couldn't authorize your card so we cancelled your reservation. We sent you an e-mail." I advised him that I had been traveling and couldn't have checked my e-mail. I asked him, "would you check your e-mail if you were on a plane this morning?" Again, he laughed and proceeded to recommend other hotels in the area. He precisely knocked his own hotel by saying, "These places are much better-- not like this at all. You wouldn't like this place anyway." His sarcasm was lost on me. I insisted he go ahead and give me a room. He again insisted he sent an e-mail as if that eliminates any responsibility. He again declined to give me a room. When I asked for the manager or a General Manager he refused to provide it. I had to insist and he wrote the name "Jerome" on the card and informed me that there was nobody else there. I continued to stand there and expect a solution. This is when he made his admission-- "Sir we are oversold by 1 room tonight which is why I can't give you a room." That is what actually happened -- they oversold the hotel and instead of walking me to another property, he decided to cancel my confirmed booking. I advised him he should still provide me a room and anticipate no-shows since my reservation is confirmed. He again declined. I did some research and later found out that my card company may decline a charge if they don't swipe the card. This is done as a security measure. Because the hotel attempted to pre-authorize my card before I presented the card, the charge declined. It wasn't a failure to pay. I hadn't even arrived yet. So, I checked my e-mail last night assuming I'd find this e-mail which the front desk agent said was sent to me. Was there an e-mail? Nope. In fact, I took a screen shot of my confirmed reservation still active as of 5PM that day. They lied. Watch out - this hotel does not know how to manage their inventory and will oversell and attempt to deny you a room. It cost me a lot of time and headaches having to seek alternative accommodations because of their failure to properly handle the situation. "Jerome" and his team don't know how to manage hotel room inventory and rather than accepting responsibility, they leave you on the street and laugh. Stay away.
